snippet: From Sunset Park to Coney Island in Brooklyn, D trains travel through one of the greatest concentrations of public artwork in the subway system.
abstract: David W Dunlap Building Blocks column praises proliferation of public artwork along the West End line of Brooklyn's D train, between Sunset Park and Coney Island; notes that works, commissioned by the Arts and Design program of the Metropolitan Transportation authority, include mosaics, cast-bronze bees and even a 20-foot-long translucent hot dog.
lead_paragraph: From Sunset Park to Coney Island in Brooklyn, D trains travel through one of the greatest concentrations of public artwork in the subway system.

headline.main: Along the D Line, Brooklyn Train Stations Are Platforms for Art
headline.print_headline: Along the D Line, Brooklyn Train Stations Are Platforms for Art
